item.title: Breonna Taylor: Kentucky city on edge ahead of prosecutor decision
item.description: Louisville fears civil unrest at it waits to hear of any charges over the killing of Breonna Taylor.

item.title: Australia whale stranding: 470 animals now beached in Tasmania record
item.description: Australian rescuers find more beached whales during a large rescue effort, but fear many are dead.

item.title: Covid: US death toll passes 200,000
item.description: The US is the worst hit country in the world and cases are still continuing to rise, data shows.

item.title: Covid: US funeral directors reflect on 200,000 death toll
item.description: Three funeral directors reflect on the human toll of the pandemic, as the US hits a milestone.

item.title: Musk: Cheaper Tesla ready 'in about three years'
item.description: Plans for lower-cost batteries and a $25,000 car did not excite investors - firm's value fell $50bn.

item.title: Johnson warns of tougher curbs if UK rules flouted
item.description: Boris Johnson says "we must reserve the right to go further" with measures if cases keep rising.

item.title: UK sends US evidence on Islamic State 'Beatles'
item.description: Alexanda Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh are accused of killing Western hostages in Iraq and Syria.

item.title: UN General Assembly: US-China tensions flare over coronavirus
item.description: President Trump blames China for the Covid-19 outbreak amid warnings of a Cold War between the two.

item.title: Europe migration: EU to reveal mandatory rules on migration
item.description: A new migration pact is set to be announced, but the measures are likely to face some opposition.

item.title: Ginsburg Supreme Court: Republicans secure vote for replacement
item.description: Senator Mitt Romney of Utah has said he would support a vote on President Trump's court nominee.

item.title: Nike expects permanent shift to online sales
item.description: The sportswear giant has seen digital sales soar and says few customers will revert back to stores.

item.title: Climate change: China aims for 'carbon neutrality by 2060'
item.description: China's surprise announcement of a long-term goal to curb emissions boosts UN climate talks.

item.title: Pascale Ferrier: White House ricin package suspect in court
item.description: Pascale Ferrier, a Canadian computer programmer, is also accused of mailing poison to Texas authorities.

item.title: Anne Webster: Australian MP and husband awarded A$875,000 in defamation case
item.description: National Party MP Anne Webster sued a conspiracy theorist over a series of defamatory Facebook posts.

item.title: Siberia climate change: Behind the scenes reporting from Yakutia
item.description: A glimpse behind the scenes of the challenges in reporting from the remote Yakutia region of Siberia.

item.title: Rakhmabai Raut: The Indian child bride whose divorce Queen Victoria approved
item.description: Rakhmabai Raut won a historic battle to get a divorce. But she was a pioneer in more ways than one.

item.title: In pictures: Ash covers Ecuador farming land
item.description: Ash from a volcanic eruption has contaminated farming land in six of Ecuador's provinces.

item.title: Internet: Old TV caused village broadband outages for 18 months
item.description: Every morning at 7am when the second hand TV was switched on, the village internet went down.

item.title: The extraordinary life of Jackie Stallone, who's died at 98
item.description: "She was a very eccentric and flamboyant person," writes her son Frank in tribute to the 98-year-old.

item.title: Israeli settlers' Chelsea boss backer
item.description: An investigation by BBC News Arabic has found that Russian oligarch, Roman Abramovich, controls companies that have donated $100m to an Israeli settler organisation.

item.title: Brazil's Amazon: Fireman 'saving what's not burnt'
item.description: Carlos Rodrigues is among the firefighters trying to save patches of Brazil's rainforest from burning.

item.title: Helena Bonham Carter and Millie Bobby Brown on Enola Holmes
item.description: Stranger Things star plays Sherlock's sister in Enola Holmes alongside Helena Bonham Carter.

item.title: Hundreds of whales stranded off the coast of Tasmania
item.description: Scores of whales have died as conservationists begin a huge rescue operation.

item.title: Wigs: A new fashion trend for black men?
item.description: A start-up in London is on a mission to make wigs cool, with a focus on young, black men.

item.title: Gordi: The pop star doctor who answered the Covid call
item.description: Australian singer Gordi is "reaching people" through medical consultations, as well as her music.

item.title: The ‘Trump train’: 'I'm tired of people putting down our president'
item.description: Trump supporters in liberal towns organise truck convoys to foster solidarity among conservatives.

item.title: How the UAE emerged as a regional powerhouse
item.description: From a mission to Mars to military expeditions, what is driving the UAE to punch above its weight?

item.title: Six African heritage sites under threat from climate change
item.description: A recent study warns that without intervention many of the continent's ancient sites could be lost.

item.title: Is the world entering a new Cold War?
item.description: The recent US-China tensions were laid bare in speeches by Trump and Xi at the UN in New York.

item.title: Why the case of a maid who battled a millionaire has gripped Singapore
item.description: The case described by some as a "David versus Goliath battle" has stirred up debate in Singapore.

item.title: FinCEN: Why gold in your phone could be funding drug gangs
item.description: Gold from a refiner used by criminals to launder drug money has entered supply chains for smartphones and cars.

item.title: Coronavirus: There's no law to 'harvest' DNA from Covid-19 tests
item.description: BBC Reality Check debunks claims about Covid tests, a death in police custody and the pandemic's origins.

item.title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg death: Voters' verdict on the Supreme Court battle
item.description: We asked voters from across the US to weigh in on the justice's death and what should happen next.

item.title: Long Covid: 'My fatigue was like nothing I've experienced before'
item.description: Thousands of Long Covid patients are waiting for help but the health service is struggling to cope.

item.title: Luis Suarez: Barcelona agree to sell striker to Atletico Madrid
item.description: Barcelona agree to allow Luis Suarez to join Atletico Madrid after a meeting with the striker's representatives.

item.title: Fans could be banned in stadiums in England until end of March at earliest
item.description: Sports are told not to expect fans to be able to return to watch live events in England until the end of March at the earliest.

item.title: Why Bellingham reminds me of a young Vieira
item.description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Karen Carney discusses the impact Jude Bellingham can have at Borussia Dortmund and where he can develop.

item.title: West Ham boss Moyes and two players test positive for Covid-19 before 5-1 win over Hull
item.description: West Ham United manager David Moyes and two of the Premier League club's players test positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Fight Talk: Floyd Mayweather, Logan Paul, Oleksandr Usyk, Derek Chisora, Mike Tyson
item.description: Floyd Mayweather has reportedly been approached by YouTuber Logan Paul to take part in an exhibition bout this year, plus more in this week's Fight Talk.

item.title: Henderson hails 'unbelievable' debut as Man Utd beat Luton to progress
item.description: Dean Henderson describes making his Manchester United debut as "unbelievable" after the goalkeeper helped his side beat Luton to reach the EFL Cup fourth round.

item.title: ‘Our foster child asked us to adopt him – by drawing himself on to a family photo’
item.description: George was neglected by his parents, then an adoption went wrong. There was only one family that he felt loved by.
